Articles.Content: People can we please stick to FASA and all the great stuff frizzank and who all may have help give us to play with on your post here ?
There is something called the off-topic section for discussing things that ain't FASA related, how Challenger blew up isnt FASA related and the discussion should be moved to off-topic
It's not like there's going to be a major update until 0.24 comes out. We might as well keep the thread on the front page until then.

Where are you getting all this? I've never heard of the SRB segment being dropped and dented as contributing to the disaster. I also haven't heard of one of the O-rings having a particular fault (as opposed to the fault being inherent in the design of the O-rings, particularly in cold weather). I also don't think NASA went away from segmented SRBs after Challenger.

The diagram of the Challenger SRB doesn't seem relevant.

The STS SRB is segmented because it's too large to cast as one piece. The field joint was redesigned, but the booster is still segmented.

Just tried this pack last night for the first time and I think it's already earned a spot in my must have mods! I especially liked the rescue pod with enough seats to use as a station life boat and the rescue textures. Keep up the awesome work!
Frizzank, I love this mod, thanks for the hard work. Have you considered doing a 1960s space program total conversion?

Frizzank, I love this mod, thanks for the hard work. Have you considered doing a 1960s space program total conversion?

Probably won't happen. Frizzank is designing FASA to be completely compatible and used in conjunction with the stock parts.

Frizzank, I love this mod, thanks for the hard work. Have you considered doing a 1960s space program total conversion?

This had occurred to me to do a complete FASA total conversion. I would need some tools for building custom missions and such but it is a fun idea. I really like the idea of putting little bits of history lessons with the rockets. I could do that now in the descriptions but no one really reads the descriptions.
Anyone else cant use docking aligment indicator with LM docking port?

I made a semi accurate representation of the Surveyor I (Atlas-Centaur) using this awesome pack.For reference (And my inspiration for making it!) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_I

Special thanks to Frizzank and all who contributed to this mod.

This had occurred to me to do a complete FASA total conversion. I would need some tools for building custom missions and such but it is a fun idea. I really like the idea of putting little bits of history lessons with the rockets. I could do that now in the descriptions but no one really reads the descriptions.

Have you thought about making fall away umbilical for the redstone. It would make it really accurate and cool. Also how hard would it be to make a die pack for the water. I know that when the capsules landed they would release a green die into the water? Is that even possible to do?
Beautiful work, congratulations!

Finally made some time to try out the LEM. Thought I'd recreate Apollo 15. Custom Saturn rocket, CSM and LEM with shiny bits! Note the chrome Real Chute and the "General LEV" rover. It's not 100% accurate but I got as close as I could with what I could find. I will point out that the LEV was attached to the side and was assembled on the Mun like the real one. I have proof! A lot of effort overall but the star is that amazing LEM!

Edited March 25, 2014 by Green Skull
Nice one think you for showing us green skull

do must I be deathsoul.... I thing that would be cool Frizzank

How do you use the ALSEP box properly? I downloaded KAS AND VNG installed them and work fine as MODS but how does the ALSEP box work and the rover box?

How do you use the ALSEP box properly? I downloaded KAS AND VNG installed them and work fine as MODS but how does the ALSEP box work and the rover box?

Place the ALSEP box on the side of you LEM then the ALSEP. When you land your LEM EVA your kerbal up to the ALSEP and simply right click and hit the grab button on the gui menu or push G key to grab. If you click on the ALSEP when its on your kerbals back there are use options.

Practice before you get to the mun as this is also how the rover box works. Note due to a surface bug by squad mine fell through the mun surface after a while.

Place the ALSEP box on the side of you LEM then the ALSEP. When you land your LEM EVA your kerbal up to the ALSEP and simply right click and hit the grab button on the gui menu or push G key to grab. If you click on the ALSEP when its on your kerbals back there are use options.

Practice before you get to the mun as this is also how the rover box works. Note due to a surface bug by squad mine fell through the mun surface after a while.

Everytime I get to the mun or even on kerbin when i let ig go off the Jebs back it explodes, I figured out all of that.
Is there going to be an IVA for the Command Module when everything is said and done on the Saturn V?

Is there going to be an IVA for the Command Module when everything is said and done on the Saturn V?

Seeing as this is Frizzank (and DennyTX), you can be pretty much assured that there'll be an IVA. I've never heard of Frizzank releasing something IVA-less.
Mercury comes to mind. Really, it could use a proper IVA, this stock one is just shoddy. Maybe Denny could rig something up...
Actually I have made only two IVA's Gemini and Big G. Im not really interested in Mercury IVA. Someone else is welcome to pick it up if they like.
